publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3477 Sarah Boyack: Congratulations to St Thomas of Aquin’s for Becoming the First Fairtrade School in Edinburgh—That the Parliament congratulates Mrs Teasdale, Ms Jenkins and the pupils at St Thomas of Aquin’s High School on their work to make their school the first in Edinburgh to achieve Fairtrade School status; considers their efforts to be a valuable contribution to making Scotland a Fair Trade Nation, and encourages the Scottish Government in cooperation with the City of Edinburgh Council to help promote Fair Trade in all schools across the city.

S3M-3477 Congratulations to St Thomas of Aquin’s for Becoming the First Fairtrade School in Edinburgh (lodged on 19 February 2009) Bill Butler*, John Park*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, George Foulkes*, Mary Mulligan*, Patricia Ferguson*, Ian McKee*, Andy Kerr*

S3M-3477 Congratulations to St Thomas of Aquin’s for Becoming the First Fairtrade School in Edinburgh (lodged on 19 February 2009) Mr Frank McAveety*, Robin Harper*, Pauline McNeill*, Stuart McMillan*, Gil Paterson*, Jim Tolson*, Marilyn Livingstone*
S3M-3477 Congratulations to St Thomas of Aquin’s for Becoming the First Fairtrade School in Edinburgh (lodged on 19 February 2009) David Stewart*, Ken Macintosh*, Hugh Henry*
S3M-3477 Congratulations to St Thomas of Aquin’s for Becoming the First Fairtrade School in Edinburgh (lodged on 19 February 2009) Jackie Baillie*
S3M-3477 Congratulations to St Thomas of Aquin’s for Becoming the First Fairtrade School in Edinburgh (lodged on 19 February 2009) Jack McConnell*
S3M-3477 Congratulations to St Thomas of Aquin’s for Becoming the First Fairtrade School in Edinburgh (lodged on 19 February 2009) Karen Whitefield*
